00034 static TGlobalData *g_event=NULL;
00035 static TFile *gInFile=NULL;

00037 // Temporary botch to let ExportPulse module know what the current entry
00038 // number is.  I'm assuming Phill's Event Navigator will provide this
00039 // functionality, so I'll remove this at that point.
00040 Long64_t* gEntryNumber;
00041 Long64_t* gTotalEntries;

00056 int main(int argc, char **argv){
00057 //load_config_file("MODULES.txt");
00058 
00059   // Parse the command line
00060   ARGUMENTS arguments;
00061   int ret = analyze_command_line (argc, argv,arguments);
00062   if(ret!=0) return ret;
00063   printf("Starting event");
00064 
00065   // Open the input tree file
00066   gInFile = new TFile(arguments.infile);
00067   if(!gInFile->IsOpen()) {
00068     printf("Failed to open input file, '%s'.  Exiting.\n",arguments.infile);
00069     delete gInFile;
00070     return 1;
00071   }
00072   
00073   // Make an initial call to singleton objects that are very likely to be called at some point.
00074   ret = PrepareSingletonObjects(arguments);
00075   if(ret!=0) {
00076      std::cout<<"Error: Problem creating a singleton object..."<<std::endl;
00077      return ret;
00078   }
00079 
00080   // Now that we've loaded the TSetupData for this run check if there are any
00081   // suggested replacements for the wiremap data
00082   //CheckSetupData(s_data, arguments.correction_file);
00083 
00084   //Event Tree
00085   TTree* eventTree = GetTree(gInFile,"EventTree");
00086   if(!eventTree) return 1;
00087   eventTree->SetBranchAddress("Event",&g_event);
00088 
00089   // Let's open the output file for analysis data, histograms and so on.
00090   TFile *fileOut = new TFile(arguments.outfile, "RECREATE");
00091   if(!fileOut->IsOpen()){
00092     printf("Could not open ROOT output file %s\n", arguments.outfile);
00093     return 1;
00094   }
00095   fileOut->cd();
00096 
00097   // Now let's setup all the analysis modules we want
00098   // NOTE: This has to be done after the output file was opened else the
00099   // modules wont have a directory to store things to.
00100   ret= modules::navigator::Instance()->LoadConfigFile(arguments.mod_file);
00101   if(ret!=0) {
00102      printf("Problem setting up analysis modules.\n");
00103      return ret;
00104   }
00105   
00106   // Setup the analysed pulse map to store / read in the pulses
00107   ret = PrepareAnalysedPulseMap(fileOut);
00108   if(ret!=0) {
00109      printf("Problem preparing analysed pulse map.");
00110      return ret;
00111   }
00112 
00113   // Finally let's do the main loop
00114   fileOut->cd();
00115   Main_event_loop(eventTree,arguments);
00116 
00117   // and finish up
00118   fileOut->cd();
00119   gAnalysedPulseTree->Write();
00120   fileOut->Write();
00121   fileOut->Close();
00122   gInFile->Close();
00123 
00124   return 0;
00125 }
00126 
00127 Int_t Main_event_loop(TTree* dataTree,ARGUMENTS& arguments){
00128 /*************************************************************************\
00129 | Loop over tree entries and call histogramming modules.                  |
00130 \*************************************************************************/
00131   Long64_t nentries = dataTree->GetEntriesFast();
00132   printf("There are %d entries\n",(int)nentries);
00133   std::cout<<"Processing file, which may take a while. "
00134      "Have patience young padawan.."<<std::endl;
00135 
00136   //set up the input data
00137   if (g_event){
00138     g_event->Clear("C");
00139     dataTree->SetBranchAddress("Event",&g_event);
00140   }
00141 
00142   // How many entries should we loop over?
00143   Long64_t start = 0;
00144   Long64_t stop = nentries;
00145   if(arguments.stop>0){
00146     if(arguments.start>0)
00147       start = (Long64_t)(arguments.start-1);
00148     if((Long64_t)arguments.stop < nentries)
00149       stop = (Long64_t)arguments.stop;
00150   }
00151   else if((Long64_t)arguments.start < nentries && arguments.start > 0){
00152     stop = (Long64_t)arguments.start;
00153   }
00154   gTotalEntries=&stop;
00155   // wind the file on to the first event
00156   dataTree->GetEntry(start);
00157 
00158   // Get the first and last module to run with
00159   modules::list::iterator first_module = modules::navigator::Instance()->Begin();
00160   modules::list::iterator last_module = modules::navigator::Instance()->End();
00161   modules::list::iterator it_mod;
00162 
00163   int q = 0;
00164   for (it_mod=first_module; it_mod != last_module; it_mod++) {
00165     q |= it_mod->second->BeforeFirstEntry(g_event, TSetupData::Instance());
00166   }
00167   if(q) {
00168     printf("Error while preprocessing first entry (%d)\n",(Int_t)start);
00169     return q;
00170   }
00171 
00172   q = 0;
00173   //process entries
00174   Long64_t jentry;
00175   gEntryNumber=&jentry;
00176   for ( jentry=start; jentry<stop;jentry++) {
00177     if(g_event){
00178       g_event->Clear("C");
00179       ClearGlobalData(g_event);
00180       dataTree->SetBranchAddress("Event",&g_event);
00181     }
00182     
00183     if (jentry%100 == 0) {
00184       printf("Completed %lld events out of %lld\n", jentry, stop);
00185     }
00186     // Let's get the next event
00187     dataTree->GetEntry(jentry);
00188 
00189     for (it_mod=first_module; it_mod != last_module; it_mod++) {
00190       q |= it_mod->second->ProcessGenericEntry(g_event,TSetupData::Instance());
00191       //if(q) break;
00192     }
00193     if(q){
00194       printf("q was non-zero when jentry was %lld\n",jentry);
00195       break;
00196     }
00197 
00198     gAnalysedPulseMapWrapper->SetMap(gAnalysedPulseMap);
00199     //gAnalysedPulseMapWrapper->ShowInfo();
00200     gAnalysedPulseTree->Fill();
00201   }
00202 
00203   //post-process on last entry
00204   q = 0;
00205   for (it_mod=first_module; it_mod != last_module; it_mod++) {
00206     q |= it_mod->second->AfterLastEntry(g_event,TSetupData::Instance());
00207   }
00208   if (q) {
00209      printf("Error during post-processing last entry (%lld)\n",(stop-1));
00210       return q;
00211   }
00212   
00213   printf("Finished processing data normally\n");
00214   return 0;
00215 }
00216 
00217 void ClearGlobalData(TGlobalData* data)
00218 {
00219   // We could put this into TGlobalData::Clear(), but we need
00220   // to be sure that's okay at the alcapana level. That is, if
00221   // Clear() deletes the TPulseIsland objects, but g_event doesn't
00222   // own the pulses, they would be deleted later. A solution is to
00223   // be sure that TGlobalData isn't called in alcapana, or ensure
00224   // that g_event owns the pulse islands at that level.
00225   StringPulseIslandMap::iterator mapIter;
00226   StringPulseIslandMap::iterator mapEnd = data->fPulseIslandToChannelMap.end();
00227   for(mapIter = data->fPulseIslandToChannelMap.begin(); mapIter != mapEnd; mapIter++) {
00228     // The iterator is pointing to a pair<string, vector<TPulseIsland*> >
00229     std::vector<TPulseIsland*> pulse_vector= mapIter->second;
00230     for(size_t i=0; i<pulse_vector.size(); i++){
00231       delete pulse_vector[i];
00232       pulse_vector[i] = NULL;
00233     }
00234     pulse_vector.clear();
00235   }
00236 
00237 
00238   for(StringAnalPulseMap::iterator mapIter=gAnalysedPulseMap.begin();
00239      mapIter != gAnalysedPulseMap.end(); mapIter++) {
00240 
00241     // The iterator is pointing to a pair<string, vector<TPulseIsland*> >
00242     AnalysedPulseList pulse_vector= mapIter->second;
00243     for(size_t i=0; i<pulse_vector.size(); i++){
00244       delete pulse_vector[i];
00245       pulse_vector[i] = NULL;
00246     }
00247     pulse_vector.clear();
00248   }
00249   gAnalysedPulseMap.clear();
00250 
00251   for(StringDetPulseMap::iterator mapIter = gDetectorPulseMap.begin(); mapIter != gDetectorPulseMap.end(); mapIter++) {
00252     // The iterator is pointing to a pair<string, vector<TPulseIsland*> >
00253     std::vector<TDetectorPulse*> pulse_vector= mapIter->second;
00254     for(size_t i=0; i<pulse_vector.size(); i++){
00255       delete pulse_vector[i];
00256       pulse_vector[i] = NULL;
00257     }
00258     pulse_vector.clear();
00259   }
00260   gDetectorPulseMap.clear();
00261 }

00263 TTree* GetTree(TFile* inFile, const char* t_name)
00264 {
00265    TTree* InfoTree = (TTree *)inFile->Get(t_name);
00266    if(!InfoTree) {
00267       printf("Unable to find TTree '%s' in %s.\n",t_name,inFile->GetName());
00268       return NULL;
00269    }
00270    InfoTree->Print();
00271 
00272    return InfoTree;
00273 }
00274 
00275 TSetupData* TSetupData::Instance()
00276 {
00277   static TSetupData *s_data=NULL;
00278 
00279   // if s_data is already setup then we can just return it immediately
00280   if(s_data) return s_data;
00281 
00282   // Check we have a valid tree for the setup data
00283   TTree* setupTree= GetTree(gInFile, "SetupTree");
00284   if(!setupTree) return NULL;
00285 
00286   // Hook up the branch in the file to s_data and load in the data
00287   setupTree->SetBranchAddress("Setup",&s_data);
00288   if(!s_data) {
00289      printf("Unable to find TSetupData branch 'Setup' in the file");
00290      return NULL;
00291   }
00292   setupTree->GetEntry(0);
00293 
00294   return s_data;
00295 }
00296 
00297 void PrintSetupData(TSetupData* s_data){
00298      if(!s_data) return;
00299   // print things out
00300   std::map<std::string, std::string>::iterator it_info;
00301   printf("### TSetupData ###\n");
00302   printf("Bank  Detector Name  Clock Tick (ns)  Pedestal (ADC)  Trigger Polarity  Time Shift (ns)  No. of Bits\n");
00303   printf("----  -------------  ---------------  --------------  ----------------  ---------------  -----------\n");
00304   for (it_info=s_data->fBankToDetectorMap.begin();it_info!=s_data->fBankToDetectorMap.end();++it_info){
00305                  std::string bankname = it_info->first;
00306                  std::string detname = s_data->GetDetectorName(bankname);
00307                  float clockTick = s_data->GetClockTick(bankname);
00308                  int pedestal = s_data->GetPedestal(bankname);
00309                  int trig_pol = s_data->GetTriggerPolarity(bankname);
00310                  double time_shift = s_data->GetTimeShift(bankname);
00311                  int n_bits = s_data->GetNBits(bankname);
00312                  printf("%s  %s\t\t%f\t%d\t\t%d\t\t%f\t\t%d\n",bankname.c_str(), detname.c_str(), clockTick, pedestal, trig_pol, time_shift,n_bits);
00313   }
00314 }

00316 Int_t PrepareAnalysedPulseMap(TFile* fileOut){
00317         // TAnalysedMapWrapper
00318    gAnalysedPulseMapWrapper = new TAnalysedPulseMapWrapper(gAnalysedPulseMap);
00319 
00320    int split = 1;
00321    int bufsize = 64000;
00322    Int_t branchstyle = 1;
00323 
00324    if (split < 0) {branchstyle = 0; split = -1-split;}
00325    TTree::SetBranchStyle(branchstyle);
00326 
00327    gAnalysedPulseTree = new TTree("AnalysedPulseTree", "AnalysedPulseTree");
00328    gAnalysedPulseTree->SetAutoSave(100000000);
00329    gAnalysedPulseTree->SetMaxVirtualSize(100000000);
00330    gAnalysedPulseBranch = gAnalysedPulseTree->Branch("AnalysedPulseMapWrapper", 
00331                                                      "TAnalysedPulseMapWrapper", &gAnalysedPulseMapWrapper, bufsize, split);
00332    gAnalysedPulseBranch->SetAutoDelete(kFALSE);
00333    return 0;
00334 }

00336 Int_t PrepareSingletonObjects(const ARGUMENTS&){
00337    // Set up the modules navigator
00338    if(!modules::navigator::Instance()) return 1;
00339 
00340    // Make sure the instance of TSetupData get's loaded 
00341    // (though in practice we can do this lazily)
00342    //TSetupData* s_data = TSetupData::Instance();
00343    if(!TSetupData::Instance()) return 2;
00344 
00345    return 0;
00346 }
